name: places/ChIJ4X_e7VlYwokRMrodX9w7ibI
formattedAddress: 419 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 419 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019-4497, USA

originalText.text:
I have been at the school for 8 years now, and I can not thank the program and faculty enough for all the work they put in to help me, and many other students. I have made many friends here, and music has been a valuable addition to my life. I feel like if I had never studied music here, I wouldn't be who I am today.
Thank you Sasha and the rest of the faculty for being incredibly helpful and great teachers.

originalText.text: This music school has been a wonderful experience for us. Our daughter began her violin lessons at SFS eight years ago and has truly cherished her time here. The administrative team has consistently provided excellent support, and the teaching staff has been exceptional. Thanks to SFS, classical music has not only enriched our lives but has also brought joy to those around us. We wholeheartedly recommend it.

text.text: This music school has been a wonderful experience for us. Our daughter began her violin lessons at SFS eight years ago and has truly cherished her time here. The administrative team has consistently provided excellent support, and the teaching staff has been exceptional. Thanks to SFS, classical music has not only enriched our lives but has also brought joy to those around us. We wholeheartedly recommend it.

originalText.text: In a city with no shortage of music teachers and schools who are more concerned with their business model than music education, SFS sets itself apart with the highest quality instruction and nurturing teachers who care for all of the students of the school, not just their own. Our child regularly receives thoughtful feedback from a piano teacher who is not his private teacher. The faculty is amazingly coordinated in this way and focuses on appreciating and making beautiful music, not simply playing the notes. We feel incredibly fortunate to have been part of the SFS community for nearly a decade because this ethos is shared by the students who always support and encourage one another. Such a special place!!

Such a special place!!

originalText.text:
Our family's experience with administration personnel Alexander Yudkovsky (Sasha) at School for Strings was highly uncivil and quite alarming.

Sasha was extremely rude and cocky during our first interaction regarding our children's registration process. Such an unprofessional individual, his arrogance and disrespectful demure only reflect how this school runs and how they treat and will treat the enrolled students and their parents. We heard a lot from parents and music teachers in NYC about how "dry" their teaching environment is. Still, our experience with Sasha exceeded our norm of what's acceptable behavior simply between two human beings.

We come from a decade-long Suzuki music education experience at a well-known Suzuki school in the area, so I could personally compare how the other schools compare to this one. And this place is a real shame as they don't consider their students as young musicians who seek to find the right environment to learn more and grow well. To Alexander Yudkovsky (Sasha), each child he enrolls is just an extra cash income for their school. No interest in developing future musicians or infusing the love of music in their young minds.

School of Strings is a place that is not interested in hearing about what kind of learner your child is, and your goal for your children. They will tell you they have no interest and will not work on finding the right teacher-student match, which I find very alarming as it is the most crucial factor in any learning environment.

Therefore, we are not enrolling our children here. I believe a thriving learning environment stems from a shared interest in growing young minds with mutual respect between a teacher and a student and their family. Sadly School for Strings showed us that equilibrium doesn't exist at their school, and we shouldn't expect one.

originalText.text:
Student support at this music school doesn't exist. Students aren't treated well with respect for their thoughts and feelings. My child is sheeshed away constantly whenever he has something to ask to the point now he is so afraid to ask any follow-up questions to his teacher because he is so intimidated by his demeanor.

When I discussed this matter further with the admin staff, I was told to expect tears here and there because that's how his teacher is known to teach.

I wished I had known what kind of teacher we were signing up for and the environment at this school better. I wasted a lot of money based on their full yearly tuition upfront with no refund policy. But the most upsetting and heartbreaking part is watching my son ask if he can quit an instrument he's been playing for several years.
